title: Frequently Asked Questions
subtitle: Find answers to common real estate questions

faqItems.question: What does Broker Adda do?
faqItems.answer: Broker Adda is a trusted marketplace for buyers, sellers, and agents. Browse verified properties, book site visits, connect with agents, and shortlist projects based on your requirements.

faqItems.question: What are the basic steps to buy a property?
faqItems.answer: Typical flow: (1) Finalize budget and location, (2) Shortlist properties, (3) Site visit, (4) Legal due diligence, (5) Pay token/booking amount, (6) Arrange home loan (if needed), (7) Sign agreement, (8) Pay stamp duty & registration, (9) Take possession.

faqItems.question: What is RERA and why is it important?
faqItems.answer: RERA (Real Estate Regulatory Authority) regulates real estate projects and promoters at the state level in India. RERA-registered projects improve transparency and buyer protection. Always check the project’s RERA number, approvals, and timelines.

faqItems.question: What is the difference between ready-to-move and under-construction?
faqItems.answer: Ready-to-move homes offer immediate possession and typically no GST if an occupancy/completion certificate exists. Under-construction units have future possession timelines and may attract GST. Always verify current tax rules.

faqItems.question: How are stamp duty and registration charges calculated?
faqItems.answer: They vary by state and can depend on property value, buyer category, location, and property type. Confirm the final amount with your state Registrar/Sub-Registrar or an authorized advisor.

faqItems.question: Can Broker Adda help with home loans?
faqItems.answer: Yes. You can seek pre-approval to clarify your buying power. Banks usually require KYC, income proofs, bank statements, ITRs, and property documents. Our partners can connect you with suitable lenders.

faqItems.question: What is a token/booking amount?
faqItems.answer: It’s an initial deposit to reserve a property. Ensure the terms (refundable or not, validity, and conditions) are clearly mentioned in a written acknowledgment or booking form.

faqItems.question: How does brokerage/commission work?
faqItems.answer: Brokerage depends on market practice and the agreement between parties. On Broker Adda, agents disclose their fees transparently. Always record fees, scope of work, and payment milestones in writing.

faqItems.question: Which property documents should I verify?
faqItems.answer: Typically: title/chain documents, latest encumbrance details, approved plans, OC/CC (as applicable), society NOC for resale, tax/dues clearance, and seller KYC. Engage a qualified property lawyer for due diligence.

faqItems.question: What do carpet, built-up, and super built-up areas mean?
faqItems.answer: Carpet area: usable internal area. Built-up: carpet plus walls/balconies. Super built-up: built-up plus a proportion of common areas (lobby, lift, etc.). Always compare prices on the same area definition.

faqItems.question: What is the difference between freehold and leasehold?
faqItems.answer: Freehold grants full ownership of land/property. Leasehold grants rights for a fixed period (e.g., 30/60/99 years) and may involve renewals/ground rent. This can affect loan eligibility and resale value.

faqItems.question: Are there any special rules for NRI buyers?
faqItems.answer: NRI/OCI buyers can purchase residential and commercial properties, while some categories (like agricultural land) may be restricted. Follow FEMA guidelines, tax/TDS rules, and consult your CA/advisor for compliance.

faqItems.question: How do I book a site visit?
faqItems.answer: On a property page, click “Schedule a Visit,” pick your preferred date/time, and an agent will confirm via call or WhatsApp. Virtual/video tours may also be available.

faqItems.question: How do I list my property for sale?
faqItems.answer: Use “List Your Property” on Broker Adda to add details, photos, pricing, and preferences. You’ll receive verified leads and can manage inquiries and viewings from your dashboard.

faqItems.question: What is the cancellation/refund policy?
faqItems.answer: It’s defined in the developer’s/seller’s booking form or agreement (e.g., deductions or forfeiture). Read the terms carefully before paying any token/booking amount and consult an advisor if needed.

faqItems.question: What costs apply after possession (maintenance, etc.)?
faqItems.answer: Post-handover, you may pay society maintenance, sinking fund, amenity upkeep, and meter/security deposits. At handover, get a snag list, defect liability details, and any applicable warranty terms in writing.
